passages.text: North America United States
Consumer Restaurants
Date 29 August 2025 Periodical

Pumpkin season is back as restaurants across the industry are launching fall menus and promotions. Starbucks, which debuted the iconic Pumpkin Spice Latte 22 years ago, launched its fall menu on 8/26, slightly later than the last two years (8/22 in 2024, 8/24 in 2023, 8/30 in 2022, 8/24 in 2021, 8/25 in 2020, 8/27 in 2019, 8/28 in 2018 and first week of September prior). Many peers have also launched their fall lineups, including Dunkin' (first launch 8/20; second drop 10/15), Tim Hortons (8/28), Peet's Coffee (8/20), Dutch Bros (8/22), McDonald's (8/29), The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf (8/20), and Caribou Coffee (8/21). Starbucks is also planning to launch Protein next month, which we suspect could come on 9/23 (as part of a second fall drop), including Protein Cold Foam and a Protein Latte. We note Tim Hortons launched a new protein beverage lineup this week.

CMG appears to be focusing in on college students, one of its core demographics. Last week, CMG launched the new Chipotle U Rewards program designed for college students, with students to receive 1,000 bonus points upon enrolling in the program, earn \(20\%\) more points on every purchase (12 points for every \(\) 1\$ spent) and receive surprise drops (e.g., during finals, game days, graduation giveaways). CMG is also collaborating with Urban Outfitters in the Urban Outfitters x Chipotle 'A Little Extra' Dorm Collection. This week, CMG launched a "Build- Your- Own" Chipotle digital- exclusive family meal offer (we suspect these bundled meals could also be used for meal prep) intended to feed 4- 6 people (priced at \(\sim\) 60- 70), with each order to include one protein, one rice, one bean, one premium side and other fixings, two large bags of chips, eight soft tacos, and forks, napkins and bowls, and is offering \(\) 10\(off "Build- Your- Own- Chipotle" orders from 8/26- 10/21. We note the unemployment rate for ages 20- 24 has increased more than other age groups over the last \~ 18 months, and could be a factor driving weakness in fast casual.
Next Week in Restaurants & Food Distributors Conference: SHAK, YUM, WING, EAT, SG.

1) McDonald's is launching a Special Edition Gold Sauce on 9/3; 2) Domino's bought back its \(\) 9.99\$ Best Deal Ever; 3) Taco Bell is launching the Decades Y2K Menu on 9/9; and 4) Olive Garden brought back Never Ending Pasta Bowl.
Lauren Silberman, CFA Research Analyst +1- 212- 250- 1285
Anish Chejerla Research Associate +1- 212- 250- 9293

McDonald's: McDonald's is launching a Special Edition Gold Sauce on 9/3 (blend of North Carolina BBQ sauce with notes of honey, smoke and mustard), featured with the Special Edition Gold Snack Wrap, Bacon Special Edition Gold (and Deluxe) McCrispy Sandwich, and McCrispy Strips. (McDonald's; 26 August 2025)

McDonald's: McDonald's is now testing CosMc's beverages at select locations, featuring the Sprite Berry Blast, Sprite Lunar Splash, Strawberry Watermelon Refresher, Popping Tropic Refresher, Creamy Vanilla Cold Brew and Toasted Vanilla Cold Brew Frappe. McDonald's will offer the lineup at \(500+\) select restaurants across Wisconsin, Colorado and surrounding areas starting 9/2. (Instagram; 27 August 2025)

Starbucks: Starbucks launched its fall menu on 8/26, featuring the iconic Pumpkin Spice Latte, alongside the new Pecan Oatmilk Cortado and returning Pumpkin Cream Cold Brew, Iced Pumpkin Cream Chai and Pecan Crunch Oatmilk Latte, as well as the new Italian Sausage Egg Bites and returning Pumpkin Cream Cheese Muffin and Raccoon Cake Pop. (Starbucks; 25 August 2025)

Starbucks: Starbucks Reserve Roasteries and Reserve stores in Chicago, New York City and Seattle introduced its fall menu on 8/26, featuring the new Pumpkin Spice Duo Flight, Tiramisu Latte, Pumpkin Spice Latte, Pumpkin Spice Whiskey Barrel- Aged Cold Brew, and other beverages and seasonal food offerings. (Starbucks; 25 August 2025)

Starbucks: Starbucks is cutting two days of weekly production at five US coffee plants in Georgia, South Carolina, Pennsylvania, Nevada and Washington to cut costs in some areas to help pay for upgrades elsewhere. The new five- day schedule will take effect in January. (Bloomberg; 22 August 2025)

Starbucks (Malaysia): Berjaya Food, the operator of Starbucks Malaysia, reported a record net loss of 292MM_ringgit ( \(69MM\) ) and a \(36\%\) decline in revenue for the year ended 6/30, with the company attributing the results to the prolonged impact of the ongoing sentiment related to the Middle East conflict. (Bloomberg; 27 August 2025)

Chipotle: Chipotle launched a "Build- Your- Own" Chipotle digital- exclusive family meal offering intended to feed 4- 6 people, with each order to include one protein, one rice, one bean, one premium side (guac or Queso Blanco), choice of three salsas/topings, shredded romaine lettuce and cheese, two large bags of chips, eight soft tacos, and forks, napkins and bowls. Chipotle is offering \(\) 10\(off "Build- Your- Own- Chipotle" orders from 8/26- 10/21 (or until 500K total redemptions). The average price for the meal ranges from\) \ \(59\) for chicken to \(\) 70\(for steak (six portions of protein, rice and beans; 8 portions of lettuce/cheese, 8 tortillas, 6 bowls). (Chipotle; 25 August 2025)

Chipotle: Chipotle is partnering with \(\sim 2K\) student athletes as The Ohio State University, University of Florida and University of Georgia, giving them each access to free Chipotle for the 2025- 2026 school year, with every scholarship and walk- on
student to receive a customized Chipotle card that grants them one free entrée per week for 15 weeks. (Chipotle; 27 August 2025)

Chipotle: Jamie McConnell, Chief Accounting and Administrative Officer at Chipotle, has resigned from Chipotle after seven years with the company to pursue another professional opportunity. (NRH; 28 August 2025)
Yum! Brands: Yum! Brands has appointed current CFO and incoming CEO Chris Turner as a Director of the Board, effective 10/1. (Yum! Brands; 28 August 2025)

Taco Bell: Taco Bell is launching the Decades Y2K Menu on 9/9, bringing back five of its most iconic, fan favorite items from the 2000s, each available for \(\) 3\(or less, including the Cool Ranch Doritos Locos Tacos, Double Decker Taco, 7 - Layer Burrito, Chili Cheese Burrito and Caramel Apple Empanada (rewards members get early access to the Caramel Apple Empanada in - app only from 9/2 - 9/8). Taco Bell is also partnering with Ed Hardy to release three limited merchandise drops every Tuesday from 9/2 - 9/16. (Taco Bell; 28 August 2025)

Pizza Hut: Pizza Hut launched new Crispy Chicken Pizzas, featuring the Nashville Hot Chicken Pizza and Chicken Bacon Ranch Pizza, available starting at \(\) 13.99\(through 11/9. (Fast Food Post; 28 August 2025)
KFC Canada: KFC Canada launched a new Pickled Menu featuring the Pickle Sandwich, Loaded Pickle Fries, Fried Pickle Chips and Pickle Pepsi. (KFC Canada; 25 August 2025)

Tim Hortons: Tim Hortons launched new protein beverages, including Protein Lattes as well as the option to add lactose- free, high- protein dairy beverage to other drinks. Tim Hortons also released Tims Chai Lattes, the returning Pumpkin Spice lineup and new Tims Salted Caramel Butter Tart. (Tim Hortons; 28 August 2025)

Tim Hortons: Tim Hortons is partnering with charging company FLO to install EV fast chargers at 100 restaurants across Canada by the end of 2028, noting 14 will be operational by the end of 2025 and 50 are targeted to be live in 2026. (FLO; 27 August 2025)

Burger King: Burger King brought back Cini Minis on 8/25 for the first time since 2018 (when they were exclusively on Grubhub). The bite- sized cinnamon rolls were introduced in 1998 and discontinued in the early 2010s. (NRN; 25 August 2025)

Burger King: Burger King launched the new BK Snackin' Hour, offering free morning and afternoon treats with a \(\) 1+\(purchase from 9/1 - 9/5, including free hash browns from 7 - 9AM and free 4 - piece Mozzarella Fries from 3 - 5PM. Burger King is offering rewards members a BOGO Whopper on 9/1. (QSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)
Burger King: Burger King debuted the Crispy Onion Whopper as its newest addition to the "Whopper By You" platform on 8/26. (Fast Food Post; 26 August 2025)

Tims China: Tims China reported 2Q system SSS - 4.8%, an improvement from recent quarters (1Q25 - 7.8%, 4Q24 - 13.3%, 3Q24 - 21.7%, 2Q24 - 14.6%, 1Q24 - 13.6%), and nine net store closures. (TH International Limited; 26 August 2025)
Domino's: Domino's brought back its \(\) 9.99\$ Best Deal Ever, available starting 8/25
29 August 2025 Restaurants Food for Thought
for a limited time (we believe through 10/5). (Domino's; 25 August 2025)

Domino's Pizza Enterprises (Australia): Domino's Pizza Enterprises, Domino's franchisee that operates the business in Australia, Japan and parts of Europe, reported 2025 SSS \(- 0.2\%\) , including \(- 0.4\%\) in Australia/New Zealand, \(+1.6\%\) in Europe and \(- 3.2\%\) in Asia. SSS were \(- 0.6\%\) in 1H and \(+0.4\%\) in 2H, and SSS in the first seven weeks of FY26 were \(- 0.9\%\) . The company is working on a turnaround, noting a structured menu reduction program is underway in Australia/New Zealand as it looks to improve quality scores and simplify store operations, while in Domino's has closed underperforming stores in Asia and is refocusing on frequency and value. The company will only open new stores when they are sustainably profitable. (Bloomberg; 26 August 2025)
Shake Shack: Shake Shack teased the debut of new onion rings in a social media post nodding to Taylor Swift's engagement. (Instagram; 26 August 2025)
Shake Shack: Shake Shack is offering a free Summer BBQ Sandwich with a \(\) 10\(digital purchase from 8/21 - 9/1. (Shake Shack; 21 August 2025)
Papa Johns: Papa Johns is returning to India with plans to open 650 stores over the next 10 years in partnership with Pulsar Capital. (Reuters; 26 August 2025)
Papa Johns: Papa Johns is offering two large 1- topping pizzas for \(\) 9.99\(each (when 2+ are ordered) for a limited time. (Papa Johns; 23 August 2025)
Jack in the Box: Jack in the Box is offering a free order of curly fries to guests who donate \(\) 1\(to support No Kid Hungry from 9/1 - 9/30. (Jack in the Box; 28 August 2025)

Olive Garden: Olive Garden brought back Never Ending Pasta Bowl, available 8/25- 11/16 (early access 8/18), consistent with the timing and length of the deal last year (in 2024, promotion was available 8/26- 11/17). The deal starts at \(\) 13.99\(with toppings for an additional\) \ \(4.99\) , consistent with 2024. (CNN; 18 August 2025)

The Cheesecake Factory: The Cheesecake Factory is offering rewards members who purchase \(\) 50\(in gift cards online from 8/4 - 9/1 a\) \ \(10\) Dining Credit redeemable for dine- in from 9/2- 9/30. (FSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)

Restaurant Industry: Based on data from the National Restaurant Association, median income before taxes at full service restaurants represents just \(2.8\%\) of revenue, down from \(4\%\) in 2019, while income before taxes at limited service restaurant was \(4\%\) of revenue, down from \(6\%\) in 2019. The weakened profitability has come despite outsized price increases, which have not been sufficient to offset the rise in food and labor costs. (Restaurant Business; 28 August 2025)

Vox Al: Vox Al, a conversational voice AI platform, raised \(\) 8.7\$ MM in seed funding led by VC firm Headline, bringing total capital raised to- date to \(\) 10\$ MM, which will be used to accelerate global expansion and launch a new office in San Francisco. (Vox Al; 27 August 2025)
Restaurant Industry: NYC restaurant Eleven Madison Park, once named the best

restaurant in the world, has decided to start serving meat again at its restaurant after shifting to a meatless menu in 2021. Starting 10/14, Eleven Madison Park will offer its \(\) 365\$ per person tasting menu with both meat and plant- based options. In recent years, the restaurant industry has seen several vegan restaurants close, noting VegNews reported last year that Los Angeles and NYC had \(20\% +\) fewer vegan restaurants than pre- COVID, while Canadian vegan concept Planta filed for bankruptcy protection in May and Kevin Hart's vegan concept, Hart House, closed all four restaurants last September. (RNN; 27 August 2025)

Wingstop: Wingstop launched its latest Wingstop Drop, Cam Ward's #1 Picks, in partnership with NFL #1 draft pick Cam Ward, a meal deal featuring 5 Lemon Pepper classic wings, 5 Hot Honey Rub classic wings, 5 Mango Habanero boneless wings and 5 Hickory Smoked BBQ boneless wings alongside seasoned fries and 2 ranch dips. (Wingstop; 27 August 2025)

Subway: Subway is running an Instagram giveaway from 8/28- 9/2 offering the chance to win the artwork from the walls of Subway restaurants to celebrate its 60th anniversary. (QSR Magazine; 28 August 2025)

Dunkin': Dunkin' is partnering with BARK for the sixth year to launch a limited- edition dog toy collection, with customers who donate \(\) 16\(to the Joy in Childhood Foundation to receive a dog toy as a thank you. (QSR Magazine; 26 August 2025)

Sonic: Sonic is introducing fall items with the new Salted Caramel Toffee Iced Coffee and Salted Caramel Croissant Bites, available in- app on 8/25 and nationwide on 9/1. Sonic is debuting a "tongue- in- cheek" PSA with podcast hosts Alexandra Madison and Jon Bouff to highlight the new menu items. (Sonic; 25 August 2025)

Sonic: Sonic launched a new ad campaign, "Where Football Goes to Burger" featuring University of Texas and Texas A&M college football players and actor and former NFL star Terry Crews. (Sonic; 28 August 2025)

Sonic: Sonic is launching the BBQ Ranch Crispy Tender Wrap, available on its refreshed \(\) 1.99\$ Menu on 9/1 alongside the FRITOS Chili Cheese Jr. Wrap, Cheesy Baja Crispy Tender Wrap, Salted Caramel Croissant Bites, Jr. Deluxe Cheeseburger, Small Floats and Soft Pretzel Twist. (QSR Magazine; 28 August 2025)
Jimmy John's: Jimmy John's opened its second location in Canada this week and plans to open a total of 12 stores in the country by the end of the year. (Jimmy John's; 28 August 2025)

CKE Restaurants: CKE Restaurants, the parent company of Carl's Jr. and Hardee's, announced that its annual Stars for Heroes fundraising campaign has raised \(\) 1\$ MM + since launching on Memorial Day. (CKE Restaurants; 27 August 2025)

White Castle: White Castle revealed the menu items most likely to be purchased late at night and early morning hours (11PM- 5AM), including Cheese Fries, Desserts- on- a- Stick and Cheese Sticks, as well as chicken offerings, including the Crispy Chicken Slider, Chicken Rings and Chicken Ring Slider. White Castle is offering special late- night deals for rewards members, including a \(\) 6\$ Cheesy Cravings Meal and \(\) 5\$ off in- app delivery, available until 9/7 from 8PM- 5AM. (White
29 August 2025 Restaurants Food for Thought
Castle; 27 August 2025)

Peet's Coffee: Keurig Dr Pepper is acquiring the JDE Peet's, the owner of Peet's Coffee, in an \(\) 18BN\(deal, and then will break itself in two, with one company to sell coffee and the other to sell cold beverages (Snapple, Dr Pepper, 7UP and energy drinks). This deal will create two separate businesses, essentially unwinding the 2018 merger of Keurig and Dr Pepper, noting the separate coffee business will have -\) 16BN in combined sales and the beverage business will have - \(\) 11BN\(. The acquisition of JDE Peet's will unlock -\) 400MM in cost synergies over three years. (CNBC; 25 August 2025)

Peet's Coffee: Peet's Coffee launched its fall menu on 8/20, featuring Popping Pearls made with coffee as a new add- on, spiced beverages and three new warm sandwiches (Cheesy Sausage Slider, Mediterranean Frittata Sandwich, Bacon Sausage Cheddar Crispy). (QSR Magazine; 27 August 2025)

Peet's Coffee: Peet's Coffee is introducing its first- ever Cold Brew Pass, with rewards members who purchase the pass for \(\) 30\(to unlock one Medium Cold Brew every day for 30 consecutive days once redeemed. (Peet's Coffee; 28 August 2025)

Chick- fil- A: Chick- fil- A will open its first restaurants in Great Britain and Singapore later this year in partnership with local operators as the brand looks to expand internationally. Chick- fil- A has committed to open five restaurants in the UK in the first two years and invest \(\) 100MM\(+\) over the next 10 years, as well as invest\) \ \(75MM\) in Singapore over 10 years. (Chick- fil- A; 26 August 2025)

Jersey Mike's: Jersey Mike's is partnering with retired Super Bowl champion Eli Manning as the brand's newest spokesperson in the brand's first major creative push as the Official Sub Sandwich Sponsor of the NFL. The new campaign has Eli Manning stepping into a "spokesperson rivalry with actor Danny DeVito. (Jersey Mike's; 26 August 2025)

Little Caesars: Little Caesars is offering a digital- exclusive deal for two large 1- topping pizzas for \(\) 4.99\(each starting 8 / 25 ahead of the start of football season. Little Caesars is leaning into its position as NFL's Official Pizza Sponsor and partnering with several NFL players as well as select NFL teams to feature specialized branding and in- game activations in local markets. Little Caesars is also bringing back the Pizza! Pizza! Pregame, an in- app feature offering guests the ability to complete specific challenges on NFL gamelays for the chance to win a variety of rewards/prizes. (Little Caesars; 25 August 2025)

Cracker Barrel: Cracker Barrel announced it was reinstating its old logo on Tuesday night after a new minimalist design sparked widespread criticism. This followed comments from President Trump earlier on Tuesday, encouraging the company to go back to the old logo. Based on a YouGov poll published Tuesday among \(\sim 1,000\) consumers, \(75\% +\) of respondents said they prefer the old logo, \(29\%\) said the new logo makes them less likely to dine at Cracker Barrel, and \(37\%\) said the chain should focus on "preserving its 'country store' heritage" above all else. (Restaurant Business; 27 August 2025)
Applebee's: Applebee's appointed Michelle Chin as Chief Marketing Officer (effective 9/2) and Jay Wong as Chief Operations Officer (effective 9/15). (Applebee's; 25 August 2025)

Denny's: Denny's launched a new value menu with its 5 Slams Starting at \(5 line up, featuring the Grand Slam Burrito, BLT&E Slamwich, 2- Egg Breakfast Slam, The Everyday Value Slam and The Super Slam, available through 10/28. Denny's also introduced limited time fall menu items, including the returning Pumpkin Pecan Pancake Slam and the new Bourbon Bacon Sirloin Dinner and Chocolate Cinnamon Milkshake. Denny's is rolling out a new loyalty program, enabling members to earn 10 Booth Bucks for every dollar spent, redeemable for a range of menu items. (Denny's; 27 August 2025)

Portillo's: Portillo's is launching two off- menu items exclusive to loyalty members, including Chili Cheese Fries and Triple Cheeseburger, available via in- store kiosks. (Portillo's, 27 August 2025)

Whataburger: Whataburger signed a multi- year partnership with the Carolina Panthers and Charlotte FC. Whataburger will have a strong presence at Bank of America Stadium, with in- stadium activations and complimentary Patty Melts and Prickly Pear Raspberry Whatafreshers on 9/21, and will serve as the presenting partner of the Panthers Girls Flag Football program and support community engagement initiatives. (Carolina Panthers; 25 August 2025)

Moe's Southwest Grill: Moe's Southwest Grill brought back Tequila Lime Chicken, this time in collaboration with Tajin. Moe's first introduced Tequila Lime Chicken last year, which was the brand's most popular limited time protein and sold out in two weeks. The chain is offering rewards members one free Queso Crunch Taco with any entrée purchase from 8/26- 9/7. (Moe's Southwest Grill; 26 August 2025)

Long John Silver's: Long John Silver's expanded its \$6 Basket lineup to offer a variety of chicken and seafood items, and brought back Pumpkin Cheesecake from The Cheesecake Factory Bakery. The chain is also offering a digital- only promotion for BOGO free Variety Platters from 8/25- 8/27. (Long John Silver's; 25 August 2025)
Papa Murphy's: Papa Murphy's launched the new limited- time Ultimate Pepperoni pizza featuring Mike's Hot Honey, available 8/25- 10/26. (QSR Web; 25 August 2025)
Captain D's: Captain D's launched new Batter Dipped Shrimp, featured in the Batter Dipped Shrimp, Fish & Fries Meal for \$5.99, available 8/25- 10/26. (Captain D's; 25 August 2025)

P.F. Chang's: P.F. Chang's is partnering with Disney's Freakier Friday movie to offer the Freakier Flavors menu, available through 9/2, representing the brand's first- ever collaboration with a film franchise. (Restaurant Business; 22 August 2025)

California Pizza Kitchen: California Pizza Kitchen launched \$10 Pizza Days for back- to- school season, offering four select pizzas for \$10 each with a \$20+ purchase on Mondays and Tuesdays. (FSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)

Dickey's Barbecue Pit: Dickey's Barbecue Pit is offering the Countdown to Labor Day catering promotion, with customers who pre- order to receive different discounts, including 20% off 8/26- 8/27, 15% off 8/28- 8/29 and 10% off 8/30- 8/31. (Dickey's Barbecue Pit; 26 August 2025)
Einstein Bros. Bagels: Einstein Bros. Bagels has appointed Jessica Serrano as Chief Marketing Officer, noting she most recently served as CMO of Dig Inn. (QSR Magazine; 25 August 2025).
29 August 2025 Restaurants Food for Thought

Dairy Queen: Dairy Queen launched its Fall Treat Collection, featuring the new Caramel Toffee Cookie Blizzard Treat, new Maple Cookie Shake and returning Pumpkin Pie Blizzard Treat. The chain is offering rewards members a small Blizzard Treat for \(0.85 with a\) 1+ in- app purchase from 9/8- 9/21 to celebrate its 85th birthday. (Dairy Queen; 25 August 2025)

Cold Stone: Cold Stone introduced new limited- time fall flavors, including Churro Ice Cream and the returning Honey Cornbread with Blackberry Jam Ice Cream, available 8/27- 11/18, along with the Caramel Carnival Churro Creation and the Cornbread is My Jam Creation. (Cold Stone; 27 August 2025)

Smoothie King: Smoothie King launched its first- ever food menu on 8/26, featuring three Loaded Toasts options (Peanut Butter, Chocolate Hazelnut, Avocado) and two Protein Boxes (Eggs & Cheese and Peanut Butter & Fruit), with additional items to roll out later this year, including Egg Clouds and Savory Chicken Tenders. The chain is also debuting limited- time bundles, including one Loaded Toast and 20oz Enjoy a Treat smoothie starting at \(9.99, available to rewards members 8/26 and all customers 9/2. (Smoothie King; 26 August 2025)
HTeaO: HTeaO is launching a new Caramel Apple Iced Tea on 9/1 for a limited time. (QSR Magazine; 27 August 2025)

Edible Arrangements: Edible Arrangements is celebrating the launch of its new cupcake line by giving away free cupcakes to everyone in the US born on 9/9 (the most common birthday in the country). (QSR Magazine; 28 August 2025)

Penn Station East Coast Subs (300+ units): Penn Station is bringing back Who Dey Tuesdays in partnership with the Cincinnati Bengals, with Bengals fans to receive a free small sub with the purchase of any sub every Tuesday after a Bengals game (win or lose). (QSR Magazine; 22 August 2025)
Wienerschnitzel: Wienerschnitzel is launching its All- American Deals promotion featuring \(4,6 and\) 8 meal combos, available starting 9/1. (Wienerschnitzel; 27 August 2025)

Rita's Italian Ice & Frozen Custard: Rita's introduced the new Apple Butter Concrete, brought back the Pumpkin Pie Concrete, and debuted the Harvest Swirl Concrete (combining both flavors), all available until 10/5. (Rita's Italian Ice & Frozen Custard; 25 August 2025)

Haagen- Dazs (200+ units): Haagen- Dazs is launching its seasonal Pumpkin Spice Collection on 9/2, featuring the Pumpkin Spice Shake, Pumpkin Spice Dazzler and the Pumpkin Spice Dipped Waffle Cone. (Haagen- Dazs; 26 August 2025)

bb.q Chicken (200+ units): bb.q Chicken is offering free delivery from 9/4- 9/7 and a free order of Ddeok- Bokki with a \(30+\) purchase from 9/8- 9/12 to celebrate its 30th anniversary and mascot's birthday (9/9). (bb.q Chicken; 28 August 2025)

Port of Subs (140+ units): Port of Subs launched 2- Foot Desserts (oversized brownies, cookies and brookies) and Reimagined Catering Boxes (2- foot subs, 6- foot subs and new desserts). (Port of Subs; 26 August 2025)
29 August 2025 Restaurants Food for Thought

Peter Piper Pizza (120+ units): Peter Piper Pizza launched the Innovation Oven Contest in partnership with Arizona Culinary Institute, with culinary students to compete to create the brand's next limited time offer. The winner will receive a \(\) 1,500\$ scholarship, and their creation will be served at Peter Piper locations throughout Arizona from 11/4- 1/26, with the winner to receive a portion of sales generated from their menu item. (Peter Piper Pizza; 27 August 2025)

Pollo Campero (120+ units): Pollo Campero is offering two pieces of dark meat chicken with a side and drink starting at \(\) 7\(on weekdays beginning 9/3, and 20 pieces of dark meat chicken starting at\) \ \(30\) daily. (Pollo Campero; 28 August 2025)

The Peach Cobbler Factory (115 units): The Peach Cobbler Factory is focusing in on expansion in Texas, noting the company has opened 12 locations in the state since March 2024, with six more to open by early 2026. (The Peach Cobbler Factory; 29 August 2025)
Another Broken Egg Cafe (100+ units): Another Broken Egg Cafe launched its fall menu on 8/26, featuring four brunch dishes and four handcrafted beverages. (FSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)

Sonny's BBQ (\~100 units): Sonny's BBQ is introducing its limited- time fall menu on 9/1 featuring seasonal flavors including maple, cinnamon and pecan. Sonny's BBQ is also offering rewards members several deals every week in September, including \(\) 2\(off a Baby Back Rib Dinner (9/1 - 9/7), BOGO free Sandwich (9/8 - 9/14), a free soft drink, tea or lemonade with any entrée purchase (9/15 - 9/21) and a free order of Sweet Potato Fries (Sweet tier) or Pecan Pie Egg Rolls (Sizzlin' and Smokin' tiers) with the purchase of an entrée (9/22 - 9/30). (Sonny's BBQ; 26 August 2025)

Wings Etc. Grill & Pub (80+ units): Wings Etc. Grill & Pub launched the September Fan Challenge, offering rewards members who place at least two \(\) 20+\(orders in September a free appetizer, redeemable by 10/31. (FSR Magazine; 27 August 2025)
Toppers Pizza (70+ units): Toppers Pizza is debuting a catering menu featuring a variety of bundles and is available with just 90 minutes notice. (QSR Magazine; 27 August 2025)
Vitality Bowls (\~70 units): Vitality Bowls is releasing the new Coffee Crunch Smoothie starting 9/1. (QSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)

honeygrow (60+ units): honeygrow announced its first- ever celebrity collaboration, the J.T. Realmuto Stir- fry, created in partnership with Philadelphia Phillies All- Star catcher J.T. Realmuto, featuring whole wheat noodles, roasted chicken and garlic butter sauce for \(\) 11.99\(. (QSR Magazine; 26 August 2025)

Dog Haus (\~60 units): Dog Haus is opening three new franchised locations in the Nashville area, with the first to open in fall 2025 and all three to be open by early 2026. (QSR Magazine; 28 August 2025)

Piada Italian Street Food (58 units): Piada Italian Street Food is offering its Student Special all day from 9/1- 9/7, which includes a regular- sized entrée with protein and a large beverage for \(\) 9\(. The Student Special will be available from 2 - 5PM and 8PM - close starting 9/8, and all day on Wednesdays. (QSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)
&pizza (\~55 units): &pizza launched new Pumpkin Spice Knots, available for \(\) 6\$ for
29 August 2025 Restaurants Food for Thought
a limited time. (QSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)
Smalls Sliders (30+ units): Smalls Sliders signed an agreement with experienced operators to open two new locations in Texas. (QSR Magazine; 28 August 2025)

Cowboy Chicken (11 units): Cowboy Chicken is launching catering packages for tailgates and watch parties as well as family meals for back- to- school. Cowboy Chicken is also offering one free kids meal with the purchase of an adult entrée every Monday after 4PM. (QSR Magazine; 28 August 2025)
Tacodeli (10 units): Tacodeli launched the Shishito Sirloin Taco on 8/25 as the brand's newest Special of the Moment. (QSR Magazine; 26 August 2025)
Bobby's Burgers (9 units): Bobby's Burgers by Bobby Flay signed a multi- year agreement with The Falcon Capital Group to open 65 units across Canada. (QSR Magazine; 26 August 2025)

Joella's Hot Chicken (9 units): Joella's is launching traditional and boneless Southern- style wings starting 9/1. The chain is offering rewards members a free six- piece order of wings with any meal purchase from 9/4- 9/14. (QSR Magazine; 25 August 2025)
MCD: Leaning Into McValue (20 August 2025)
SBUX: Brew Tracker: July 2025 (20 August 2025)
US Retail & Restaurants: Weathering the 2Q25/3Q25 Outlook (14 August 2025)
PFGC: Full Truck of Case Growth (13 August 2025)

USFD: The Case for Margin Flow- through (8 August 2025)
TXRH: Traffic Wows + Costly Cows (8 August 2025)
PZZA: Pepperoni, (Innovation) Pipeline & Positive SSS (8 August 2025)
WEN: Frosty Outlook (8 August 2025)
MCD: Building McMomentum (7 August 2025)
BLMN: Choppy Outlook, Chopping Guide (7 August 2025)

The Equity Rating Dispersion Chart depicts the following:

The proportion of recommendations that are rated "buy", "sell" and "hold" over the previous 12 months. This is shown for securities issued in the stated region e.g. "Europe Universe". See rating definitions below. This is represented by the "Companies Covered" bars in the chart. The percentage value displayed above the bar is the proportion as a percentage. E.g. \(50\%\) above the "buy" / "Companies Covered" bar means that \(50\%\) of DB's equity research covered companies over the past 12 months have a "buy" rating.
Next to each of the three respective bars showing the proportion of "buy", "sell" and "hold" recommendations we provide two additional bars to show:

- The proportion of "buy", "sell" or "hold recommendations where Deutsche Bank and or/Affiliates provided MIFID Investment or Ancillary Services in the past 12 months. This is represented in the "MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services" bar. The percentage value displayed above the bar shows the proportion of Companies Covered with the given rating where DB has also provided MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services in the past 12 months. E.g. \(50\%\) above the "Cos. w/ MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services" bar means \(50\%\) of the Companies Covered with the rating stated have also received MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services from DB.

- The proportion of "buy" (or "sell" or "hold) recommendations where Deutsche Bank and or/Affiliates has provided Investment Banking services in the past 12 months for which it has received compensation. The percentage value displayed above the bar shows the proportion of Companies Covered with the stated rating where DB has also provided Investment Banking services in the past 12 months. E.g. \(50\%\) above the "Cos. w/ Investment Banking relationship" bar means \(50\%\) of the Companies Covered with the rating stated also have an Investment Banking Relationship with DB.
Buy: Based on a current 12- month view of TSR, we recommend that investors buy the stock.
Sell: Based on a current 12- month view of TSR, we recommend that investors sell the stock.
Hold: We take a neutral view on the stock 12- months out and, based on this time horizon, do not recommend either a Buy or Sell.
TSR = Total Shareholder Return. Percentage change in share price from current price to projected target price plus projected dividend yield
Newly issued research recommendations and target prices supersede previously published research.

Macroeconomic fluctuations often account for most of the risks associated with exposures to instruments that promise to pay fixed or variable interest rates. For an investor who is long fixed- rate instruments (thus receiving these cash flows), increases in interest rates naturally lift the discount factors applied to the expected cash flows and thus cause a loss. The longer the maturity of a certain cash flow and the higher the move in the discount factor, the higher will be the loss. Upside surprises in inflation, fiscal funding needs, and FX depreciation rates are among the most common adverse macroeconomic shocks to receivers. But counterparty exposure, issuer creditworthiness, client segmentation, regulation (including changes in assets holding limits for different types of investors), changes in tax policies, currency convertibility (which may constrain currency conversion, repatriation of profits and/or liquidation of positions), and settlement issues related to local clearing houses are also important risk factors. The sensitivity of fixed- income instruments to macroeconomic shocks may be mitigated by indexing the contracted cash flows to inflation, to FX depreciation, or to specified interest rates - these are common in emerging markets. The index fixings may - by construction - lag or mis- measure the actual move in the underlying variables they are intended to track. The choice of the proper fixing (or metric) is particularly important in swaps markets, where floating coupon rates (i.e., coupons indexed to a typically short- dated interest rate reference index) are exchanged for fixed coupons. Funding in a currency that differs from the currency in which coupons are denominated carries FX risk. Options on swaps (swaptions) the risks typical to options in addition to the risks related to rates movements.

Derivative transactions involve numerous risks including market, counterparty default and illiquidity risk. The appropriateness of these products for use by investors depends on the investors' own circumstances, including their tax position, their regulatory environment and the nature of their other assets and liabilities; as such, investors should take expert legal and financial advice before entering into any transaction similar to or inspired by the contents of this publication. The risk of loss in futures trading and options, foreign or domestic, can be substantial. As a result of the high degree of leverage obtainable in futures and options trading, losses may be incurred that are greater than the amount of funds initially deposited - up to theoretically unlimited losses. Trading in options involves risk and is not suitable for all investors. Prior to buying or selling an option, investors must review the 'Characteristics and Risks of Standardized Options", at https://www.theocc.com/company- information/documents- and- archives/publications. If you are unable to access the website, please contact your Deutsche Bank representative for a copy of this important document.

Participants in foreign exchange transactions may incur risks arising from several factors, including the following: (i) exchange rates can be volatile and are subject to large fluctuations; (ii) the value of currencies may be affected by numerous market factors, including world and national economic, political and regulatory events, events in equity and debt markets and changes in interest rates; and (iii) currencies may be subject to devaluation or government- imposed exchange controls, which could affect the value of the currency. Investors in securities such as ADRs, whose values are affected by the currency of an underlying security, effectively assume currency risk.

Unless governing law provides otherwise, all transactions should be executed through the Deutsche Bank entity in the investor's home jurisdiction. Aside from within this report, important conflict disclosures can also be found at https://research.db.com/Research/ on each company's research page. Investors are strongly encouraged to review this information before investing.

Backtested, hypothetical or simulated performance results have inherent limitations. Unlike an actual performance record based on trading actual client portfolios, simulated results are achieved by means of the retroactive application of a backtested model itself designed with the benefit of hindsight. Taking into account historical events the backtesting of performance also differs from actual account performance because an actual investment strategy may be adjusted any time, for any reason, including a response to material, economic or market factors. The backtested performance includes hypothetical results that do not reflect the reinvestment of dividends and other earnings or the deduction of advisory fees, brokerage or other commissions, and any other expenses that a client would have paid or actually paid. No representation is made that any trading strategy or account will or is likely to achieve profits or losses similar to those shown. Alternative modeling techniques or assumptions might produce significantly different results and prove to be more appropriate. Past hypothetical backtest results are neither an indicator nor guarantee of future returns. Actual results will vary, perhaps materially, from the analysis.

The method for computing individual E,S,G and composite ESG scores set forth herein is a novel method developed by the Research department within Deutsche Bank AG, computed using a systematic approach without human intervention. Different data providers, market sectors and geographies approach ESG analysis and incorporate the findings in a variety of ways. As such, the ESG scores referred to herein may differ from equivalent ratings developed and implemented by other ESG data providers in the market and may also differ from equivalent ratings developed and implemented by other divisions within the Deutsche Bank Group. Such ESG scores also differ from other ratings and rankings that have historically been applied in research reports published by Deutsche Bank AG. Further, such ESG scores do not represent a formal or official view of Deutsche Bank AG. It should be noted that the decision to incorporate ESG factors into any investment strategy may inhibit the ability to participate in certain investment opportunities that otherwise would be consistent with your investment objective and other principal investment strategies. The returns on a portfolio consisting primarily of sustainable investments may be lower or higher than portfolios where ESG factors, exclusions, or other sustainability issues are not considered, and the investment opportunities available to such portfolios may differ. Companies may not necessarily meet high performance standards on all aspects of ESG or sustainable investing issues; there is also no guarantee that any company will meet expectations in connection with corporate responsibility, sustainability, and/or impact performance.
